title: Grants a tax credit to day care providers
summary: Grants a tax credit to day care providers; allows a qualified taxpayer a tax credit towards income derived from business attributable to services provided by a registered family day care program; defines "qualified taxpayer" and "home day care services".

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3345

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CLARK, JACOBS -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         BRENNAN, GALEF, SWEENEY, TOWNS  --  read  once  and  referred  to  the
         Committee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to granting a tax credit to day
         care providers

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  The tax law is amended by adding a new  section  606-a  to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S  606-A.  CREDIT  FOR  CERTAIN  DAY  CARE  SERVICE PROVIDERS. (A) FOR
    4  PURPOSES OF THIS SUBSECTION:
    5    (1) "QUALIFIED TAXPAYER" MEANS A PROVIDER OF DAY CARE LICENSED  BY  OR
    6  REGISTERED  WITH THE OFFICE OF CHILDREN AND FAMILY SERVICES, PURSUANT TO
    7  SECTION THREE HUNDRED NINETY OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW,  TO  OPERATE  A
    8  GROUP FAMILY DAY CARE PROGRAM OR FAMILY DAY CARE HOME.
    9    (2) "HOME DAY CARE SERVICES" MEANS SERVICES PROVIDED BY A GROUP FAMILY
   10  DAY CARE PROGRAM OR FAMILY DAY CARE HOME LICENSED OR REGISTERED PURSUANT
   11  TO SECTION THREE HUNDRED NINETY OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW.
   12    (B)  A QUALIFIED TAXPAYER SHALL BE ALLOWED A CREDIT, TO BE COMPUTED AS
   13  HEREINAFTER PROVIDED, AGAINST THE TAX IMPOSED BY SUBSECTIONS (A) THROUGH
   14  (D) OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED ONE OF THIS ARTICLE. THE AMOUNT OF THE CREDIT
   15  SHALL BE THE LESSER OF FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS OR THE  AMOUNT  OF  THE  TAX
   16  IMPOSED BY SECTION SIX HUNDRED ONE OF THIS ARTICLE FOR THE TAXABLE YEAR,
   17  REDUCED  BY  THE CREDITS PERMITTED UNDER SECTIONS SIX HUNDRED TWENTY AND
   18  SIX HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE OF THIS ARTICLE, MULTIPLIED BY  A  FRACTION.  THE
   19  FRACTION  IS  COMPUTED  AS  FOLLOWS: THE NUMERATOR IS NET INCOME DERIVED
   20  FROM BUSINESS ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE PROVISION OF HOME  DAY  CARE  SERVICES
   21  (OR  ZERO  IF  SUCH  INCOME IS NEGATIVE) AND THE DENOMINATOR IS NEW YORK
   22  ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME.
   23    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   24  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06561-01-1
